discussion.content: El NAT con ESP usa UDP 4500

If NAT is used ESP uses UDP port 4500 and D would be the answer.
If no NAT is used ESP doesn't use any port and B would be the answer .

To me it seems NAT is used and I would answer D.
It's D, as ESP running UDP port 4500.

choices.C: No sessions have been deleted because of memory pages exhaustion.
choices.B: All the sessions in the session table are TCP sessions.
choices.D: There are 166 TCP sessions waiting to complete the three-way handshake.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C.

Selected Answer: AC
memory_tention_drop = conserve mode drop 
epherumal = 0 
so correct answer is A and C

Selected Answer: AC
It's A and C

choices.C: It is currently in kernel conserve mode because of high memory usage.
choices.D: It is currently in system conserve mode because of high memory usage.
choices.B: It is currently in FD conserve mode.
choices.A: It is currently in system conserve mode because of high CPU usage.

questions.question_text: Which statements about bulk configuration changes using FortiManager CLI scripts are correct? (Choose two.)

choices.C: When executed on the All FortiGate in ADOM, changes are automatically installed without creating a new revision history.
choices.A: When executed on the Policy Package, ADOM database, changes are applied directly to the managed FortiGate.
choices.B: When executed on the Device Database, you must use the installation wizard to apply the changes to the managed FortiGate.
choices.D: When executed on the Remote FortiGate directly, administrators do not have the option to review the changes prior to installation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following tasks are automated using the Install Wizard on FortiManager? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D

choices.C: Import policy packages from managed devices.
choices.E: Import interface mappings from managed devices.
choices.D: Install configuration changes to managed devices.
choices.A: Preview pending configuration changes for managed devices.
